website_summaries.verdict: Unless you have a huge home theater or tough-to-drive speakers, the Yamaha RX-V379's combination of useful features and solid performance may be all you need.
pros: The Yamaha RX-V379 provides solid sound quality, with features such as 4K and 3D pass-through, 100 watts per channel, Bluetooth, four HDMI inputs, and auto speaker setup and calibration, all for an affordable price
cons: Rather than use sturdy speaker wire binding posts, the Yamaha RX-V379 has less-secure spring clip connectors for three of the five channels

customer_reviews.title: Impressive sound, scared the wife with surround sound.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this receiver to replace my outdated 10 year Panasonic receiver. I needed to update to HDMI and digital sound connectors and found this one. The entire family enjoys the surround sound home theater experience. Great buy. I knew I did good when my wife looked around in surprise during a movie. So now....Lifetime movies in surround sound...unintended consequences.
customer_reviews.author: Rob53

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic budget receiver.
customer_reviews.text: I got this receiver to go in my upstairs/secondary home theater area (master bedroom) and I am very happy with it. I wanted something with 4K pass through and able to handle Dolby Digital True HD and DTS Master Audio tracks on blu-rays. It is a simple receiver with good clear sound. I would recommend this to anyone who is not in need of a high end piece of equipment, but needs the features to take advantage of 4K and high def audio formats. For a serious home theater buyer, this would not be a good fit for a primary receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Jay W. Lundgreen

customer_reviews.title: So far it's working great and sounds awesome
customer_reviews.text: So far it's working great and sounds awesome. Has a really cool feature that allows you to balance speakers with each other to optimize the sound (it includes a little microphone you can place in your favorite listening location to tune the system up). That helped balance my big front speakers with smaller rear set. Overall the output is a bit lower than receivers I've used in the past but it still goes way beyond filling the room with sound. Sounds clear enough to make friends... loud enough to make enemies. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic upgrade from Vacuum tube
customer_reviews.text: Great performance for the money. I purchased this to replace my all in one surround sound unit. I've been using it for a solid 6 months now and it performs great. I'm happy to finally get all my devices channeled through one receiver without splitters, adapters and switch boxes to manage them all. I have my TV, FireTV, Blueray, PC and Playstation all routing through this and they all work wonderfully. I was additionally surprised when the connected device names where automatically displayed on the LED when I switched to them. I guess it's been a while since I last purchased a receiver. My last receiver was vacuum tube haha.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Walker

customer_reviews.title: Sounds amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Sounds amazing and was very easy to hook up. I like the simple controls. You can customize the sound for each of four different "scenes" that you use most often. We cut the cable cord and used an optical audio cable to get the sound from the TV to surround sound when watching off the antenna. BluRay and video games plug right in with HDMI. Has more than enough power for our 20'x30' living room and the 5-channel stereo makes even radio sound fantastic. Very,very pleased with this purchase and definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: This receiver broke after about a year and a half. It had the same problems where it would cut off during loud points. Then one day I turned it on and nothing. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: OneTimez1

customer_reviews.title: Everything I've Needed
customer_reviews.text: I've always been big into making sure my music, gaming, and movies have good sound. Having great picture is only half the experience, and sometimes even less. All that said, this is a GREAT starting receiver. Initially used with PS4, Apple TV, 1080p TV, and 3.0 sound, I have since upgraded to a 4k TV, utilizing its single 4k HDMI compatible input. The sound is perfect. It's easy to set up your speakers and optimize them using the microphone that it comes with. Eventually, I'm planning on upgrading to 5.1 surround, and this will be capable of handling the upgrade. I have been very happy with my experience over the past couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Starr

customer_reviews.title: Much-desired feature Bluetooth is a FAIL...
customer_reviews.text: Good receiver from the little use I've had of it. Purchased the 479 same time frame and no issues with that one at all, from using it soon after reception. But opened and hooked up the 379 maybe 2.5 years later and no Bluetooth connection for anything. Huge disappointment !!!!! Calling on Yamaha soon for support/resolution/exchange. Open to knowledgeable suggestions...
customer_reviews.author: E.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great intro receiver
customer_reviews.text: This does everything it's supposed to and it does it well. I haven't had any problems with it. This is my first receiver so I don't have anything to compare it to but it does what I want for my introduction to home theater. This receiver doesn't have built-in WiFi, just bluetooth, so I purchased a Chromecast Audio to stream my music. I have it connected to the Aux port on the front. Certain apps (including certain webpages in Chrome) can be streamed directly to it. Streaming music from something like iTunes or Foobar2000 will take a little more effort.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: This Is a Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace an old receiver from another maker that had failed. Right out of the box it recognized my existing speakers and did its self checkout of the installation. Later, it seamlessly paired with a new subwoofer I bought. It sounds great and has not given me a whiff of trouble. It paired with my Samsung smart TV and the two of them hit it off from the start. I can use my TV remote to turn it on (it starts automatically when the TV is turned on and it did this by itself) and change the volume on the receiver. Get this one and don't worry about it.
customer_reviews.author: Car Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great entry-level receiver...
customer_reviews.text: Replaces a defective entry level Denon. While the Denon's virtual-surround was a tad better, (when it worked), this unit really shines when cranking up the tunes. Many more options for sound equalization. I also like having the ability to perform most functions from the units front panel as well as the remote. I have had it now for about four months and not a single hiccup. Easy set-up. Very intuitive. Haven't even had the need to use the owner's manual. Only regret is it does not have Wi-Fi. I use my Sony BRD to pull signal from computer.
customer_reviews.author: Craig J. Carvalho

customer_reviews.title: Solid receiver for the money
customer_reviews.text: Solid receiver for the money. Been using it about seven months now and it works very well. No real complaints about it, it does what I wanted it to do and while it doesn't have some of the nicer features of more expensive units, well, I didn't expect those. If you're looking for a solid receiver for music, TV, games, etc, this is a solid buy.

I've read this kind of thing is typical in many systems running different brands together.

The Bluetooth feature is very handy and enjoyable. For the money and an entry level product, this is well worth the money.
